abstract: The Obama administration has reached a critical stage in its effort to rein in Wall Street. | Timothy F. Geithner is joining Warburg Pincus as president. | A snub by Snapchat underscores the changing perception of Facebook in the tech industry. | The checks from JPMorgan Chase keep on coming.
snippet: The Obama administration has reached a critical stage in its effort to rein in Wall Street. | Timothy F. Geithner is joining Warburg Pincus as president. | A snub by Snapchat underscores the changing perception of Facebook in the tech industry. | ...
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has reached a critical stage in its effort to rein in Wall Street, Peter Eavis and Ben Protess report in DealBook. The push to reshape financial regulation hinges on negotiations in the coming weeks over the Volcker Rule, which bans banks from trading for their own gain.

headline.main: Pressure to Finish Volcker Rule Quickly
